result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Adams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reginald Adams in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Reginald Adams.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Competency Hearing proceeded.  
State does not challenge doctor report.  Defendant does challenge doctor report.  Parties stipulate to Dr. Jenna Goebel to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Goebel.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Goebel, and testimony, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent. Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  
The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards. Court order FORTHWITH for treatment.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 4.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Adams in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Reginald Adams in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing. Case remains calendared in Br 4. 
  Competency hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Reginald Adams not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctor's report, however defense requests more time. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Reginald Adams in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Reginald Adams in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reginald Adams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
